alert.note: Alert for Lake; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 4:03PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Tropical Storm Ian will pull away from the FL peninsula today, with historic rainfall amounts reported across east central FL from the system. River levels along the Saint Johns will continue to rise as rainfall drains into the basin. The forecast point at Astor has risen to Major Flood Stage and is forecast to crest near the Flood of Record at 4.6 ft late tonight or early tomorrow, then decline to Moderate Flood Stage by the weekend. Interests along the river should be prepared for major flood impacts for the next few days. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Major flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM EDT. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...St Johns River Near Astor. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.0 feet, Major flooding occurs, with water entering the first story of many homes and businesses along the river. Some roads inaccessible and rescues likely needed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 4.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM EDT Thursday was 4.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 4.6 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 2.3 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue St Johns River Astor 2.3 4.1 Thu 3 pm 4.4 3.7 3.7 3.7 3.9 &&
